data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you always face forward, you’re moving in the same direction as you came from. When you turn left, you are facing left. When you turn right, you are facing right. When you take 10 steps forward, you are moving forward. When you take 10 steps backward, you are moving backward. So, the answer is Yes.

The fourth step is to return you to the starting point of the previous direction. So, the answer is Yes.

Turn left at the crosswalk for the final 5 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

Facing forward will always take you forward. 4 steps is the same as 6 steps. So, the answer is yes.

A 1:3 ratio has 9:3:3 = 9:3 = 9:4 or 9:4:4 = 5:1 of putting you back at the starting point to have 2 steps taken, and then taking 7 steps taken back to at the same point you started from. So, the answer is No.
